intro: Epilobium spicatum var. substenophyllum, commonly known as narrow-leaved willowherb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, often calcareous soils. The plant features slender, erect stems and lanceolate leaves that are usually less than 2 cm in width. Its flowers are small, clustered in spikes, and are typically pink or red, attracting various pollinators. It is often found in wet meadows, riverbanks, and other damp habitats.
